description: This course will examine the challenges of reporting on a dangerous region that that is undergoing immense change. It will pay special attention to the complexities of covering the Arab Spring, democracy and Islam, Egyptian revolution and counter-revolution, and the war in Syria. The course is designed for upperclassmen who are interested in journalism, NGO work, the foreign service, or international business, or just want to learn what goes into producing the news. Students will interview guest journalists in what goes into producing the news. Students will interview guest journalists inperson or via Skype, and will also examine the role of social media in Mideast reporting.
name: Comparative Journalism: Philosophical Issues
